channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X Is Leaving San Francisco
item.description: The office closure marks the end of an era for the site formerly known as Twitter.

item.title: GrubMarket has acquired Good Eggs
item.description:
Sources with knowledge of the deal said it was an all-stock transaction that valued Good Eggs slightly above its previous valuation of $22 million.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google Search Is an Illegal Monopoly, US Judge Rules
item.description: Nearly a year after the US government took Google to trial, a judge has found that the tech giant violated antitrust laws. A new trial will determine how Google should be penalized.

item.title: UK’s Riverlane scores $75M to correct quantum errors
item.description:
Quantum computing may still largely be in the theoretical domain, but the money that it’s attracting is very real.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: People Are Big Mad About the 'House of the Dragon' Season 2 Finale
item.description: “Did I just watch a 70 minute trailer for Season 3?” is just one of the reactions fans have posted online about the season's "disappointing and poorly executed" closer.

item.title: India’s EtherealX puts $5M seed toward fully reusable launch vehicles
item.description:
Indian space-tech startup EtherealX aims to test its fully reusable medium-lift vehicle in 20.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Controversial Kids Online Safety Act Faces an Uncertain Future
item.description: While it easily passed the Senate, the House began a recess without bringing the bill—which critics say would keep young people from accessing vital information on topics like sexual health—to the floor for a vote.

item.title: OpenAI co-founder Schulman leaves for Anthropic, Brockman takes extended leave
item.description:
John Schulman, one of the co-founders of OpenAI, has left the company for rival AI startup Anthropic. In addition, OpenAI president and co-founder Greg Brockman is taking an extended leave — through the end of the year — after nine years at the company to “relax and recharge,” the company confirmed. Peter Deng, a product […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mountain Bikers Are Rewilding Land by Paying the Government to Do It
item.description: A new nature-restoration project in Wales is being funded by an unusual source: thrill-seeking downhill lovers.

item.title: Secretaries of state urge X to stop its Grok chatbot from spreading election misinformation
item.description:
Grok — not to be confused with the homophonic AI startup Groq that this morning raised over $600 million — has been spreading false information about Vice President Kamala Harris on X, the social network formerly known as Twitter. That’s according to an open letter penned by five secretaries of state and addressed to Tesla, […]
